intro: Sertula arvensis, commonly known as the field sertula, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as fields and roadsides. Its leaves are compound, with leaflets that are lance-shaped and have a hairy texture. Sertula arvensis is often found in temperate regions and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
